website_summaries.verdict: If you only iron occasionally and need to watch your budget, you'll get excellent performance at an equally impressive price from this model. It's a bit less powerful than most other Rowenta irons, but gets the job done without any fuss.
pros: 1725 watts of power and 350 microholes on the soleplate make short work of ironing
Like other Rowenta irons, there's a self-cleaning function, anti-calcium system for extended life, and 3-way auto shutoff for safety
cons: Smaller water tank than other models
A handful of owners claimed the temperature control is limited, making it difficult to get the desired temperature

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Less Than a Year
customer_reviews.text: After less than a year of use, water now literally pours out of the bottom of the iron...not the face plate, but the bottom of the iron. I am not happy about the quality of this product!
customer_reviews.author: Susanne Young

customer_reviews.title: I thought this would be a great iron that would last for at least a few ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great iron that would last for at least a few years! TEN MONTHS later, the iron started leaking at the bottom for no apparent reason. There was no return allowed as too much time has gone by. It was a "lemon". Expensive iron! My last cheap iron I bought at Target and it lasted 5 years. I use my iron every day in my business of dress making.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: This iron sucks!
customer_reviews.text: This iron doesn't last very long, I've only had this one for 8 months and it's already dripping water on the steam setting and shuts off after 15mins. It doesn't matter how well you care for your iron it will still malfunction to quickly. I had many different models of Rowenta Irons & they have all failed so this time I bought the SquareTrade extended warranty. This was a waste of money because the iron failed before the manufacture warranty was up. In the future I will buy an inexpensive iron so if it stops working don't have to spend hours trying to find out how to return it.
customer_reviews.author: pp

customer_reviews.title: It is not an "ANTI-DRIP" iron!
customer_reviews.text: I always buy Rowenta irons - they are simply the best iron around. I purchased this one after researching for hours. One of the main factors that I was looking for was that even the packaging on it says "anti-drip". This is NOT THE CASE! I am on my second one of this same iron because I thought maybe the first one was a lemon. Replacement one drips and leaks just as bad as the first. Pretty disappointed since the main reason I purchased this iron was because of the anti-drip claim.
customer_reviews.author: jcskzs

customer_reviews.title: Not the Rowenta of yesteryear...
customer_reviews.text: I think this is my last rowenta. I have been buying them since I was a self-reliant adult (about 25 years). However, the lifespan has shortened with each consecutive model I bought. My first lasted a solid 10 years. My second lasted about 7 year. The next was 5 years, then only 3 years, and my most recent model started having problems in only 3 months. I have been waiting weeks for the reapaired device to be returned but in the meantime I am iron-less. I will seriously look at other brands in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Twiz

customer_reviews.title: The worst iron I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This has been the worst Iron I have ever owned. It has constantly leaked, both hot and cold. It stops heating while ironing after an hour or two use. I am a quilter and need an iron that is dependable, not temperamental. I took care of the iron as instructed in the handbook. Did all that the Rowenta customer service recommended. I am deeply disappointed as this was not a cheap iron. My previous irons lasted 10 to 15 years. Not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce H.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Maine
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE: If you are ok with only a one year warranty, spend the money. If not, buy a cheaper iron you can replace every year or two. I purchased this iron in April 2014, average use of 2.5 hours per week, and it no longer works. Very disappointed spending $78 to last a mere 2.5 years. Customer service offered a small discount to buy a new one due to the expense I would incur mailing my iron to New York for estimate. Won't buy Rowena again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Chekouras

customer_reviews.title: Product does not do justice to rowenta name....nothing but trouble with this
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but trouble. Had to send back for repairs for spitting brown stuff. Got it back.....cord placement makes it uncomfortable to iron. Plus now not hot enough for a 1700 watt iron...does not even get wrinkles out of cotton....Am going to call again, but if have to send back again...I am without iron in meantime.Do not recommend. I am calling again to try for a refund. I bought extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Roepstorff

customer_reviews.title: Rust spots after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product! This iron was never that great but I thought I should give a Rowenta a shot. It goes through lots of water using the steam function so I’m always filling it. Today after 3 months I iron a BRAND NEW white shower curtain and not only did it leak water all over the place but it left rust spots! The shower curtain is ruined and I didn’t even hang it up yet. So mad. I contacted the company so we will see what they say. I miss my Black and Decker !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replaces my 25 year old Rowenta
customer_reviews.text: Finally decided to replace my 25 year old Rowenta which started to leak water. Very pleased so far with this new Rowenta which I've had about a month.. ... I quilt and use the iron every day. I particularly like how easy it is to regulate how much steam - from none to full blast. At full blast, it's one heck of a lot of steam. I also like the pointed tip. Easy to fill with water. The iron is quite a bit heavier than my previous one which took a while to get used to. Overall, I'm very pleased with this new iron. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: gemcinti

customer_reviews.title: ... pay so much for an iron but I am glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to pay so much for an iron but I am glad I did. This iron is larger and a little heavier than any previous iron I have ever owned but it really does the job nicely. There are hundreds of steam holes in the bottom so you really get a huge blast of steam when you call for it. It decalcifies automatically and you can use regular tap water in it. The The cord is extra long and the iron looks impressive. It heats up really fast. The only thing that I can say negative about this iron is it - like every other steam iron I have owned - drips when you press the steam button.
customer_reviews.author: Spitzerone

customer_reviews.title: I don't believe the other glowing reviews that it's the best thing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a Rowenta steam iron that didn't leak, and I have had about 5. The Focus is no different. It leaked from the first use; I should have sent it back but I just figure that the even the geniuses at Rowenta don't know how to or won't make a decent product. The only way to prevent the Rowenta Focus from leaking is to not put water in it. I don't believe the other glowing reviews that it's the best thing since sliced bread. It does make a great door stop.
customer_reviews.author: Forescore

customer_reviews.title: Poor steam capability
customer_reviews.text: I've always bought Rowenta, believing them to be the highest quality consumer irons. This model has disappointed. Reading some glowing reviews I wonder about my experience but this is actually a replacement when I returned the original. The problem is I iron for 20 or 30 seconds, then stand the iron up and move the clothing around on the ironing board - then I often have to wait 20-30 seconds after reapplying the iron until steam begins again. Sometimes a full minute or more! Very frustrating standing there waiting for the iron to steam. Hate it!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Spieles

customer_reviews.title: Recommed Without Hesitation
customer_reviews.text: Have used Rowenta for years. I iron everything, sheets, undershirts, hankies - just because. Rowenta has never let me down. This has a huge amount of steam vents and irons beautifully. Likely a bit heavier than some, but it feels good in the hand and does a great job of pressing clothes. I would recommend without hesitation and definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: LiteraryLady

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend - Leaks water on your clothes
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Rowenta iron. Amazon replaced the first as a courtesy. Both frequently leak water all over the item I am ironing making it very wet and unwearable. I am not hitting the clean button so this is not the issue. It leaks more water, more often when you set it to any steam setting. I use it with the steam off and press the button for steam. Based on 2 irons, I cannot recommend this product. I wish I had purchased the more expensive Shark model. I had one for 5 years with no issues. Tried to save a buck. Mistake
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Started out great...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a seamstress. I love(ed) this iron. The steam was great. The cornering around buttons is great. The steaming capabilities for wedding dresses was great. It has great weight...I don't like lightweight irons. I've had it for about 14 months. Now, water just pours out of it. Leaves water stains on everything. I've followed all directions. I paid a lot of money to get what I needed. Is there a fix for this or do I need to spend more money to buy a new iron????
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Only buy if you have regular tap water in your house, and even then with reservations
customer_reviews.text: I returned this one as soon as I read the instructions. Please note that you can’t use this iron if you have softened water in your house! Regular tap water only - not even bottled spring water or distilled water, which I have done before (a pain in the neck, but once you have soft water you have to make adjustments). Also, the blue color makes it difficult to see the water fill level. And “use once the heating light goes off” - I heated for 10 minutes and it was still on. Come on, ironing is unpleasant enough!!
customer_reviews.author: Arlene

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I'm a quilter and I need a good, hot iron with steam. At first I loved this iron. I like a heavier iron to help iron my quilt blocks. However, after a year of use, it leaks like crazy! I can only put in a little water when I'm ready to steam or else it flows out the bottom. I have purchased several Rowenta, knowing they are supposed to be high quality and all have leaked eventually. So from now on, I'm getting the hottest and cheapest I can buy! Why spend big bucks for the name when it doesn't perform any better than the cheap ones?
customer_reviews.author: JKJ

customer_reviews.title: Love this iron
customer_reviews.text: Love this iron. I had an old Rowenta iron that just wasn't working anymore. After ironing, my clothes looked as if I hadn't bothered trying. But I had the old iron for approximately 20 years. Long enough to be sold on the product. When I decided I couldn't put off getting a new iron any longer I went looking for a new Rowenta. I am not disappointed. This iron presses your clothes with very little effort and after wearing the item all day it still looks great!
customer_reviews.author: York, PA

customer_reviews.title: Best part is anti-calc
customer_reviews.text: I've had 4 previous Rowentas. They all leak. They all get weak in the spray control. However, they're the best iron out there and I have a business which provides products I sew. It's what I always come back to. I like the weight of them...it doesn't hurt my wrists like the "professional" irons. I like the steam feature. It needs to be filled constantly, though. I like the auto shut off. I like the cord. I like that it doesn't tip the way cheaper irons do. I have 2 nasty burn scars from irons tipping over, over the years. I love that it is self cleaning and pulls the crap out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Kline

customer_reviews.title: Best iron I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best iron I have ever owned. I'm terrible at ironing pleats in my slacks. This does the job! If I put the pleat in the wrong place, I can rearrange the slacks, re-iron, and the old pleat is ironed out and the new pleat is perfect. I can do all my ironing at once, hang clothes in the closet, and they are ready to wear even a week or more after ironing! My only complaint is that it is easy to accidentally move the dial, making the iron much hotter (or cooler) then you need for the item you're ironing.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like a sieve.
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews that say this iron leaks. And then believe them. I’ve had it for about three weeks and I’ve noticed water drops here and there. Today, when I picked the iron up, my ironing board was soaked. As I was ironing, water was dripping all over my son’s shirts. I had to go over them continually to get them to dry. The whole bottom of the iron was wet. Believe the reviews that say they leak - because they do! This iron will be returned within the hour. I have no luck with irons.
customer_reviews.author: Vvvvgggg

customer_reviews.title: Great, until the darn thing leaks
customer_reviews.text: I used to love it. It was the best iron I ever had, produced copious amounts of steam and ironed quickly and crisply---UNTIL, water began gushing out of the bottom, below the handle. It has saturated my ironing board, the floor and the clothes I was trying to iron. It has never been dropped. What is the deal with this thing? I paid over $100 for this iron and I thought it would last longer than this!
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating - lasted less than a year
customer_reviews.text: I'm very frustrated that I spent some extra money to get an iron that I thought would work well and last for a reasonable period. After it started failing over the last several months, it is now useless and I have had the iron for less than a year. I thought I could rely on Rowenta's warranty, but that is also useless, as it requires you to take the iron to one of about 12 authorized service centers - none of which is anywhere near me. I'll now have to buy a new iron and will look for something much less expensive that will likely last longer than the Rowenta one.
customer_reviews.author: Momof4

customer_reviews.title: Good iron. Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight and build quality. The customer service is a joke however. I had a failure: it would not work after the Auto Off feature shut it off. Called customer service and they said it was under warranty and they would fix it or send me a new one. Now get this, she said they would send a shipping label by email and that would take a couple weeks,,,,(a couple weeks to hit a button on the computer?????), and that it would take four to six weeks for the repair/replacement to be completed. I've had two Rowenta irons because I like the way they feel in my hand, both failed.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Fouts

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last Long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron March 2017 and I just purchased a new CHI iron today. This is the second Rowenta iron I had that lasted barely over 18 months. It seems for such a simple appliance, it should last much longer when you are buying a "high end" iron. I will say that while it lasted it worked very well. Good weight distribution and excellent steam output.
customer_reviews.author: SMH

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I am not a big reviewer but felt so compelled to write this to hold Rowenta accountable for such a low quality product. I hardly ever splurge on items like this, but thought this would be worth it. The product is poorly made and does not even have an on off switch which is very dangerous. It's spit steam and water all over my hand which hurt. I am very disappointed in this product, but can't afford a new one. Please don't purchase to save yourself the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: emshef

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: RIGHT ITEM; RIGHT PRICE; EXPEDITIOUS DELIVERY. BOUGHT THIS FOR MY WIFE TO REPLACE HER OTHER TWO ROWENTA IRONS THAT WERE JUST WORN OUT. VERY WELL MADE WITH GOOD CONTROLS WHICH ARE EASIER TO USE THAN ON THEIR OLDER VERSIONS. THE ONLY PROBLEM IS THAT IT WOULD BE NICE IF THEY OFFERED THIS IN COLORS. OF NOTE, THE FULL FILL WATER LEVEL CAN BE HARD TO SEE THROUGH THE DARK BLUE TRANSPARENT TANK, SO I HOLD IT UP TO A LIGHT TO PASS THROUGH IT. MUCH EASIER TO USE THAN THE PRIOR MODELS. I HAVE USED ALL OF THEM.
customer_reviews.author: JTFIII

customer_reviews.title: Not much different than other irons
customer_reviews.text: Just like other irons - if it has water in it, I have to wait for the water to heat up before using or it will "leak". Even if not using steam functionality - the water has to be hot enough (or perhaps the seals around the tank have to be warm enough) so that it doesn't leak out when the iron is leveled for pressing. I use a silicone iron mat and when I need to reheat the iron (when it is has turned itself "off" from no activity between pressing items) I lay it on the silicone mat for a moment and stand it back up to reheat before using it.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Mommu

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and works well
customer_reviews.text: We had two irons fail in a matter of months (other brands). I bought this one as a well reviewed pro option, hoping it would last. After several months of use, I definitely like it. It has a couple of quirks worth mentioning. There is no off switch. You either let it go dormant using the safety features (which makes me nervous), or you cut the power by unplugging or switching off a power strip. I sometimes hit the heat control and change the temp by accident while ironing. On the plus side, the water fill is very well engineered, and the iron steams very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Mando Guy

customer_reviews.title: My iron
customer_reviews.text: I have only had my Rowenta Everlast for like 3 weeks and it has been perfect so far, on low temp it doesn't steam but when it is set to a high temp with steam or without it is freaking awesome,, my iron leaked one time when I was not hot enough to start ironing but after that no problems, I let my iron sit there on and safety works too it shuts off on time jus as its supposed to, my fingers hits the temperature dial sometimes and I have to wait till the it gets to the temperature again but that is minor I jus try to be more careful..... thanks Rowenta
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Irons linen the first go round, no repeating!
customer_reviews.text: This iron is my 2nd Rowenta and it's the best iron I've ever had. I have several shirts I iron and a few are linen. I couldn't believe how well it ironed linen and my husbands canvas pants that are new and had to be ironed to be worn. I really appreciate the port to put water in, it's bigger and has a cover that opens and closes so no spills. It's balanced and easy to maneuver, the most steam vents I've ever seen on an iron and the temperature controls are accurate as well. NO complaints from me!
customer_reviews.author: Wordsmith

customer_reviews.title: Nice but needs better instructions.  I need more than pictures.
customer_reviews.text: This is possibly an average iron, after I went to the internet and YouTube to figure out what the instructions were trying to tell me on how to use and clean it. I still cannot figure out the steam functions. The instructions are ALL PICTURES. Why should I have to guess as to how to operate this iron having only pictures? I am still not sure what they were trying to tell me about cleaning it! I found the pictures were almost enough to make me send it back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Trouble Free For 10+ years!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned this model of Rowenta for more than 10 years. It recently began spitting water. I know I could have simply cleaned the calcium deposit which accumulated after so many years however, I chose to replace my Rowenta with the exact same model because 10 years of problem free for any small appliance deserves a repeat performance. I’m just glad the price was still reasonable and the iron was still available! I may even clean the calcium deposits from this one on occasion. I’ve cleaned the original iron. It works so I donated it.
customer_reviews.author: Ms B

customer_reviews.title: It turns on fine but after about 3 minutes or so
customer_reviews.text: This iron was a defect! It turns on fine but after about 3 minutes or so, the heat decreases drastically and it leaks water. Terrible Purchase
customer_reviews.author: Garette Craig

customer_reviews.title: It’s almost amazing.
customer_reviews.text: OK. This is a quality product. But there is a serious design flaw. As you are ironing if you bump the temperature control with your finger you can jack up the heat and destroy your clothes. I was doing an iron on patch and it melted onto my pants and put a big mark on the iron itself. I feel like I have to set the temperature and then put a piece of tape over the dial. I really love this product but this Design flaw is dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Trades

customer_reviews.title: Great Rowenta Iron
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful iron. I like the the controls are dial controls and are away from the handle. It has LOTS of steam. Love this iron. I am a quilter and a great iron in a must! The last iron I had was a different brand, with the heat settings on the handle which meant that the temperature control was always being changed, inadvertently. With this Rowenta, this will not happen. Hope that this iron lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A

customer_reviews.title: ... this iron for 14 months and it is the worst! I've had it repaired twice because it leaks
customer_reviews.text: I've had this iron for 14 months and it is the worst! I've had it repaired twice because it leaks. It still leaks. I don't store it with water in it, don't use distilled water, leave it standing up, all in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions. Leaks like a sieve. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron
customer_reviews.text: Great iron. Heats up fast, consistent heat, steady steam, heavy enough without being a chore to use. Only one complaint, and this is that they could have given a little more thought on wire management. There is no way to wrap the wire, could use a small lip at the bottom or something.
customer_reviews.author: NickM

customer_reviews.title: A Very Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: An iron. What can go wrong? As a guy who does all his own ironing and wants it trouble free and reliable, and having use a score of irons over a lifetime, THIS is the best one I've used. The cord is long. The steam control is superb. The weight is substantial. The handling is easy. The termp control is excellent. Looked at many reviews. This Rowenta is the best! Highly recommended for a long-term, moderate investment in a necessary household appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Amos Miller

customer_reviews.title: WOW ! This iron is Great !
customer_reviews.text: WOW ! This iron is Great ! At first I was not sure that I would like it since it was a bit heavier than the Irons I had been using but as soon as I began using it I was Very Happy that I had it to use. I use a lot of steam when pressing yards of fabric and when pressing seams on quilt blocks and this Iron gives a wonderful flow of steam from the many, many ports and it glides like a dream. So Very Happy with this purchase. I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a new iron.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: First off, this iron is very heavy. I've decided to keep it, because I don't do a huge amount of ironing. Plus, my wrist can always use some physical therapy. Second, the 'point' that gets so much attention as a key feature to achieve wrinkle-free corners is fine......not great. I see no difference from a regular iron tip. And since the extra point = extra length, this iron doesn't fit in my existing iron holder (when not being used.) So it's actually a small negative. But, it works well, and seems well-made, as you'd expect from 'made in Germany.'
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Iron I Have Ever Bought
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this iron for several months now, and absolutely love it. It gets very hot, and provides an immense amount of steam without spitting. I prefer the metal plate over the ceramic of my old iron, less drag. As my water is very hard (calcium),Ii use bottled drinking water. It is advised not to use distilled, and I empty it out after each use. I thinks doing these few steps, keeps the iron operation at peak performance.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Good temperature control, plenty of steam, sizable  water reservoir.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. This is one of the few irons that can easily take the wrinkles out of linen shirts. The steamer is enough to iron the heaviest denim you have and most of the time we end up keeping it at 50% which seems to be plenty of steam to iron most clothes. The water reservoir is is adequately sized for the copious amounts of steam this iron generates. Temperature control works well. One minor gripe I have is that when you're ironing, your hand blocks the indicator light, which is annoying, but not enough to take a star off.
customer_reviews.author: dr.k

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice iron, but notheing special
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice iron. Nothing that makes it stand out from any others. It is advertised as "dripless" and that has not been my experience with it. Within 6 months, there would be an occasional drip while ironing or a series of drips over a small distance. This is the second Rowenta I've had that has the same drip issues. I was hoping by "upgrading" to the second purchase, the problem wouldn't exist. That wasn't the case. I'm disappointed in this product, especially the cost vs performance. It was my understanding that Rowenta is one of the leading manufacturers of irons. After having the same issues with 2 Rowenta irons, I'm going to Black & Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Van E. Martindale

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Well it worked great for 2 months now the steam button won't pop back up after pressing it. Good ole rowenta irons let's see how long it takes to be fixed through square trade protection. Notorious pieces of junk rowenta irons I had a few over the years my first one lasted like 10 years since then lucky if I get 2 years Now 2 months not happy .
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this iron for several months now and its absolutely fantastic. I love the 400 steam holes and the fact that the tip of the iron is very pointy. It really makes a difference ironing in between pockets and buttons. Other reviews had mentioned it leaking, so for that has not been of any concern, in fact I actually own two of the same iron, that's how much I love it. I will say that if there was one flaw, it wy be the location of the temperature control. it does occasionally get bumped to a lower temp depending on the size of your hand. If you ask me, it's a 100% buy.
customer_reviews.author: Batlstar

customer_reviews.title: so good. I use my iron every day and really ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I use my iron every day and really love the Rowenta irons. Unfortunately, they are notorious for leaking after long use. Their customer support is excellent. I wish I could find a better iron that steams and presses like Rowenta but I've tried many and none compare. I replace mine every two or three years. This particular model is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: GF

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it lost its power to heat up
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my aunt who is a tailor and she uses iron a lot. She had Rowenta before and she liked it so I decided to update her old iron with new one. She says the it doesn't heat up as much as on the beginning and it has been just a few months since she's been using it. She also complains about the hue, she can't see the water level inside clearly. I had a high expectation of this German made iron.
customer_reviews.author: EWELINA

customer_reviews.title: Leaked on first use : Replacement seems fine
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, feels great, but defective right out of the box. Have been using one of those Panasonic irons with the football shaped plate. It's been great, but I decided to give this a shot. Leaks from the front tip. Leaves streaks and line shaped water spots on clothes. Will be sending it back for a replacement, but after all I've heard about Rowenta, I am extremely disappointed. Edit : Received the replacement and it seems great. Fingers crossed that it will stay that way.
customer_reviews.author: Syed

customer_reviews.title: I Wasn't Really Into It
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in 2017 and was actually pretty excited about it. It has a nice weight, and although I never dropped it or anything, it feels really sturdy. It works good as far as irons go, with the precision tip helping out with certain garments, but it still doesn't do a great job with my button-ups, and I still have a hard time with deep wrinkles. I was also a little disappointed that it sometimes leaks, especially when tilted or using the steam feature. I just feel like for the price it wasn't a great buy, I should have gone with one of those steamers. I still have it, it just doesn't get used.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron
customer_reviews.text: I iron clothes frequently and this iron does a great job. It releases enough steam, continuous or burst, to help iron out wrinkles and the weight of it is good also. I've purchased several Rowenta irons from department stores but I think this one is better than others I've bought. The others started to leak after awhile, I've only had this one for about 3-4 months so I'm hoping this one doesn't. As of now, I'd buy another one if I needed one.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Jam

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with this iron in the beginning. After 90 days the cord and plug got so hot I couldn't touch it to unplug it. I called Rowenta and they are sending me a postage paid label to send it for REPAIR!!! They estimate three weeks before I will get the REPAIRED iron back. If you cant replace a seriously ( potential fire hazard) defective product after only 90 days....I'm not impressed. The rep knew exactly what I was talking about...don't think my iron was the first on with this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K. Fennell

customer_reviews.title: Iron LEAKS horribly and ipossible to iron wet clothes that’s how bad it is!!
customer_reviews.text: This iron leaks horribly!! Other reviews said this was an issue and some didn’t. Cannot use this because it leaks so badly at the temperature setting knob. Useless!!! Completely horrible and can’t return it either! Save your money-DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Nuttall

customer_reviews.title: Best iron I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Alright folks, buck up and pay a little extra for an iron you won’t have to throw out if it falls off the ironing board one day. This puppy is worth it. Nice and heavy, steams like a pro, heats up insanely fast. This thing is going to last. I’ve owned a few irons and have traveled a lot (used hotel irons all over) and this is my favorite iron to date. You, too, can have a favorite iron. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hermiller

customer_reviews.title: Rust Spots - Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: One month to the day from ordering ( and probably the third time I used this iron) got rust spots on white shirts when ironing. Frankly would NOT recommend ANY Rowenta iron as this is the third Rowenta I've had that leaves rust spots on clothes when ironing even when storing without water and leaving the water "lid" open. The others lasted at least a year or two without this issue. Irons fine if you do not need the steam feature.
customer_reviews.author: california mom

customer_reviews.title: Extremely heavy iron
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron to replace an older Black & Decker iron that started leaking water. I was shocked at how heavy this iron was! I would certainly have had structural damage to my wrist from repetitive stress if I had used it for very long. I immediately packed it up for return, went to Target, bought an updated Black & Decker iron for half the price and less than half the weight--and it irons extremely well. I can only imagine who is testing these irons and for how long they are ironing! Quality control definitely needs to be improved!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen C. Stone

customer_reviews.title: First thing I noticed it's easy to hit and move the temp dial with your ...
customer_reviews.text: Decided to start washing and ironing my dress shirts and not subject them to the dry cleaners anymore. So I did my research and bought the Rowenta. First thing I noticed it's easy to hit and move the temp dial with your fingers which is annoying and really needs to be reviewed by the manufacturer. I followed the instructions for first time use and used tap water. Brown stains appeared from a few steam holes which was disappointing. Luckily I ironed them away and now use 50/50 tap and distilled water. Steam is plentiful but it will use a lot of water and require frequent filling. So far I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Mclaren

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Iron
customer_reviews.text: This iron is wonderful! I thought that it was a bit heavy when I first got it but it glides over the material with such ease. My son likes linen and it can be difficult to get the wrinkles out but this iron works fantastic. I would recommend this for sure. What a great produce. None of us iron as much as we used to but if you need something ironed this is the iron for you. I also sew and it is wonderful for all sewing projects as well.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love that it requires tap water
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was time to replace my 20 year old iron that had a stuck heat gauge. Boy is this ever an improvement! I had never paid more than $25 for an iron, so I wanted to see if I had missed anything. This iron is very sturdily constructed. I love that it requires tap water. The ability to steam vertically is nice and it does put out lots of steam. I would prefer it to have an off setting and a neater method of wrapping the cord when not in use. But if it lasts me 20 years like my prior iron, I'll be satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Muskrat Love

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far
customer_reviews.text: We have gone through many clothes irons over the years, and cannot seem to find one that lasts more than a few years. Perhaps this is typical for the product category. After the last one broke (after a year), I decided to buy this Rowenta. It was certainly not cheap, but was rated as the #1 iron in an online article. So far, it works well. You can use tap water, rather than distilled water, which is nice. No problems thus far. It is fairly heavy and seems to be well built.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: The iron is definitely much better than previous ones I have had (though more expensive) I have only used it once so comments are limited. Previous ones have had issues with leaking, and my first use of this did not show any problems. Steam amount seems excellent, and works smoothly. Some may feel it is rather heavy, and it is considerably heavier than the cheaper ones I have used, though I think for what it's being used for...getting out wrinkles...this may not be a bad thing. I did get a very good price on it...the price does jump around so using a price monitoring site is very helpful, so I did consider it a good value.
customer_reviews.author: folkie

customer_reviews.title: Best household iron, lots of steam
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought my first rowenta iron years ago for me and been recommending it to my family and friends. I had to replace my old one after a bad fall. Had it for years. Super happy with my new iron. Makes ironing a breeze. Hubby does his owns shirts because he finally knows how to do it thanks to the super extra steam. It makes it easier. He has a lot or cotton Oxford shirts which everyone knows how difficult are to iron. The only downside will be that to need to refill very often. I don’t find it very difficult but be prepared if you do loads of ironing at a time.
customer_reviews.author: pedro l. sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed and dissatisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Why this iron would get damaged like that?? Can Rowenta use a different metal? I bought this Table Iron for my wife in September of 2019, less that a year has passed. Yesterday she started to use it after a little while and the water/vapor coming out was dirty, corroded color, horrible. I tried to clean it and i did what I could, it brought a lot of the dirt but it wasn’t enough. As curious as I am, I took some screws out to get to the button of the problem, but i found the iron was sealed, even inside. See the pictures and judge yourself. Seriously, less than a year??? I wish I could get a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Thorrens

customer_reviews.title: Rowenta DW5080 Steam Iron
customer_reviews.text: Reviewed in July 2020 from TX USA. Bought this in Jan 2019 online from Amazon, and using it for last 1.5 years now. Wanted Steel base plate, hence preferred this product. Using it to iron approx. 40 cloth items every week, and operating it twice a week. Its fantastic, and best serving the purpose, and so far there are no issues. Using the tap water, so scalling generation is common, that's not the fault of the iron. Hence following the process explained by Rowenta to descaling the product, and it helps really well. Happy, and would suggest- go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Leaked water
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this iron in March 2019 specifically to use for my quilting. So it doesn’t get heavy use by any means. Yesterday I went to use it and water poured out of it when I moved it. So very disappointed. When paying $70 for an iron I expect it to last more than 18 months. Up until now it was a nice iron. Heated up fast and steam function was great. Yes, it uses water fast but with the amount of steam it produces that’s now a surprise. Won’t be buying another Rowenta though.
customer_reviews.author: Newmom24

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Iron...REALLY
customer_reviews.text: I am a little unusual because I actually like ironing...it's kind of "zen". This iron was said to be the best just below the one that was ridiculously expensive, even for someone who wants a great iron. This iron is wonderful! The weight of it, the amount of steam, and that you can use tap water...and should! This is the iron to buy. Happy ironing.
customer_reviews.author: PhillyZ

customer_reviews.title: Cadillac of irons. Or should I say Mercedes. It’s over engineered and I’m loving it!
customer_reviews.text: Best iron ever. Heats up like a champ, in 2.2 seconds. Controls work great. Steam out the wazoo. Does consume a lot of water if your set to full steam. No problems for far. One month in it’s been great. I’m ironing everything I can get my hands on. One thing I will say is it’s big. Doesn’t fit in my iron caddy. Wire door mounted “cheap” rack. This is the Cadillac of irons. You're not parking it in the compact car spot. Robust design including the cord, which I think I’d prefer to have the retractable cord in retrospect.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It ALMOST made it two years.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in April of 2018 for $70 and it almost lasted two years. I guess that's as good as German engineering gets you these days. The iron was working, but after storing it on the shelf when I got done ironing, the tank has let all the water leak from the tank all over my freshly ironed shirts, and will not hold any water now. There are no cracks or anything but as soon as you lay it down to iron the water just runs out the holes in the plate. Beware because it only lasted 22 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rouse

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the 6 months it worked.
customer_reviews.text: So I have had this iron for less than a yr. I originally loved it! It was such a great iron. The upright steam feature is why I bought it. I hate to iron and with this iron you could just use steam and wahla, wrinkles gone! But it suddenly stopped putting steam out in the upright position. I have followed all manufacturer's suggestions with resolution. So bummed because I absolutely loved this iron.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. The handle is too small, so it 's not for someone with larger than smallish hands. Also, the water sprinkler buttons are placed in extension of the handle, so I find myself pressing these buttons by mistake. Not a good thing. It is a touch heavy, but I do want that in an iron. Its base though is wider than expected, and that can be tricky when ironing in narrow spaces. The steam gets very hot, so one has to bear that in mind. The steam vents located all over the plate is a plus. Nice design though, the good quality of Rowenta, but a few things they could improve.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mihailescu

customer_reviews.title: Possibly a Return
customer_reviews.text: Heating light never turns off.Filling cup was not included. I suspect this was returned and reshipped. This seems to be happening more and more at Amazon. Although I have only had it a few days it does appear to work well. Trying to decide if I want to return it.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisS

customer_reviews.title: Less than one year old and it leaks. Badly.
customer_reviews.text: The pros: The pointy tip is wonderful for corners and edges. The price is good. The cons: The "auto off" is more of a "sleep" function and the iron has to be unplugged after every use. It doesn't seem to get any hotter than my previous iron. It uses a huge amount of water without actually putting out that much more steam than my previous iron. The biggest con, however, is that I haven't even had it for a full year (11 months, almost to the day) and it began leaking today. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Handle Design
customer_reviews.text: As an iron it does everything expected of a Rowenta, but. But the engineering of the handle is so poor that its rated one-star as a warning to others. The problem? Take close look at the handle. The water spray and steam burst functions are integrated into the handle. The iron's center of gravity is such that when balancing the iron my hand rests on the water spray lever causing water to spurt out. Not good. OK, I've tried moving my hand back away from the lever but it naturally rides up the handle when ironing to the center of gravity position. This iron is simply poorly designed. What's happened to that vaunted German engineering?
customer_reviews.author: OregonJon

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but...
customer_reviews.text: I love how well this irons! Totally worth it, but there are a couple of drawbacks... We previously had an iron that the cord sucked back up into the base. That was awesome! This one is a mess. For the life of me I don't know why they oriented the cord clip sideways. It's almost impossible to be useful. Also, the temperature control dial is not in the best spot. Most times when I pick up the iron I end up accidentally turning it. So I have to adjust it again. But it does "iron" wonderfully
customer_reviews.author: Whatlight

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy and the cord is too short.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Norelco iron for about 30 years and someone dropped it and the plastic rest broke so I decided to purchase a new one. I got the Rowenta. The cord is too short and it is very heavy, but it irons extremely well. Pouring in the water for the steam is a bit awkward. I'll probably get used to the weight of it, but that short cord is hard to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret H. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely would not buy this iron again. I purchased and after 6 weeks the auto shut off kept coming on. Iron would heat up and shut off. Returned and ordered the same iron thinking it was a fluk. After 6 weeks in the middle of ironing a garment the same thing happened. Thank you to Amy at customer service. I am retuning g the item and purchasing a different iron. Have had several Rowenta irons in the past.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like a seive after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic iron if you don't put water in it. Water leaks out just about as fast as you can put it in after a few months. It doesn't just leak through the base plate, either. It comes out everywhere. For the first couple of months, I loved this iron. It lived up to the little 'no leaks' thing printed on the side. After those few months though, this iron will absolutely not hold water. Even a little bit. Seriously. It just comes right out. It got really bad just after the warranty expired.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Wrinkles Beware! This Workhorse is Heavy Duty!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this iron would be too heavy, but after using it for a few hours I'm in love. I haven't had the chance to try all the features but will update my review in a month if needed. The temperature control dial is too easy to accidentally bump and inadvertently adjust, but my other irons have been the same. Not sure why they always seem to place the dial where your fingers go, but no biggie.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works well but I don't see what makes it stand out from other $20-$30 irons. Retracted cord is a plus. The cap is tough to pop off and click back on. Takes a long time to cool off after being unplugged so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: I’ll never own another iron brand
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always bought cheap irons until I started working in corporate and started learning how real adults do things. This iron is absolutely amazing. It takes no effort to crease and knock out wrinkles and the Auto-Off is a plus. I can just hold it up to my pants and the wrinkles come out with barely any contact. I haven’t had any issues with is at all
customer_reviews.author: Tierra Miller

customer_reviews.title: Leaks brown on fabric!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this iron, but it just didn’t live up to my expectations. It leaks if you try to use it before it’s hot enough, and the liquid that comes out is brown! I’ve been using bottled distilled water and this still happens. I’ve owned it for 10 months and I already switched back to my old Rowenta. So disappointed in this iron, especially given the brand reputation and how much it costs.
customer_reviews.author: gibbas

customer_reviews.title: Great iron, until it’s a leaking mess! Never buying one again!
customer_reviews.text: After 1 1/2 years it just pours out water, and I mean pours! It will drain almost the whole tank. I loved this iron so much, it’s sooo nice. Gets very hot, great even steam... just was wonderful and then it just started leaking. So disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Iyariel

customer_reviews.title: I feel like Cinderella right before the Ball
customer_reviews.text: First time in my 25 years of ironing that I DIDNT just buy the cheapest iron at Walmart. What was I thinking! I feel like Cinderella right before the Ball! Food tastes better, flowers smell sweeter, my wife looks thinner.....its amazing! Rowenta has given me my life back and I'm gonna be a better man for it
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good iron that produces a lot of steam
customer_reviews.text: I've has this iron for about a month now and so far so good. It produces a lot of steam (on the top steam setting) which makes it great for ironing business shirts. The downside of this is that you need to top up the water quite often, but I really don't mind. The shape of the soleplate is great, wider at the bottom with a pointy tip for ironing between buttons. It sits sturdily both when ironing and when resting on its end. Some of the other reviewers have written about problems with the iron leaking water, fortunately mine has not had that issue yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sammie D

customer_reviews.title: Bottom leaks water after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I've had this iron for two years and it was a wonderful iron for about the first 18 months. Since that time it has sporadically leaked water from the bottom edge. When it is standing up, water will sometimes pour out the bottom. This happens occasionally through the holes in the metal ironing plate as well however it is much more often that it does so out the bottom. I am very disappointed in the iron.
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: Useful but short life
customer_reviews.text: Had it for 3 years then started leaking water from the bottom. Especially when standing upright. Self clean useful but inconsistent. worked well when it did, the plate is of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alptuu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent iron
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron because it was a highly recommended product and had something I really needed an automatic off feature. I was forgetting to turn off iron when I left sewing room and getting distracted and leaving old iron on-- that was a concern of mine. Anyway this iron was at an excellent price point when I bought it in December 2018 and has worked flawlessly ever since. Highly recommend. Has great steaming ability for pressing quilting projects.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality, but just another iron in the crowd
customer_reviews.text: I thought "It's a Rowenta (and a model made in Germany), it must be great!" Unfortunately, this iron isn't impressive. It seems well-built with easy-to-use controls, but it's nothing special. It has a small reservoir and the on-demand steam bursts are too short to iron even small loads of clothes. The biggest disappointment is the rectangular, hard-plastic handle that painfully digs into my hand while ironing. This iron needs an ergonomically-contoured handle with a rubberized grip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't have gotten a better one
customer_reviews.text: This iron is by far the best. let me start by saying i have OCD and do not bring my clothes to dry cleaners because im afraid my lines when ironing will be messed up or just not the way i like it. I iron all my weekly dress clothes on Sunday, 7 pants 7 shirts, Iron is amazing , its heavy , non stick coating is great since i use corn starch. The water tank does have to be refilled a couple of times but its fine since there are hundreds of steam holes to make ironing quick and easy. This is by far the best iron i have gotten.
customer_reviews.author: Santi Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Really great quality iron. I feel like I have a professional iron for a great price. Before I purchased I looked up what was the best iron and this name brand came up. I wanted a good quality iron to iron stubborn wrinkles in uniforms. I hate ironing and usually try to purchase wrinkle free uniforms however I have a few that I have to iron. The only thing I don’t like is the cord isn’t retractable and I have gotten used to that feature on previous irons I owned however I wouldn’t trade this one for all the irons I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse T

customer_reviews.title: I love this iron
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron! Such a random thing to replace since my old one worked like new, but this one is a world of difference. Steam feature works like no other! Highly recommended. I bought it after staying with a friend that has one. These complaints about them leaking surprises me because mine doesn’t and neither does my friends and he’s had it for well over a year. Fake reviews? Mishandling? IDK, but I love mine!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Wish I didn't give away my old iron...
customer_reviews.text: Because this Rowenta never really measured up. I bought it when a friend told me that she liked hers & I thought that mine (at 15 years old) would go soon. Bad choice. The Rowenta does not get very hot. And today after a little more than one year (just checked my Amazon order), it leaks water & only heats to warm, ugh. I do not recommend it & will go back to a $15-20, any-brand iron that served me so well before. (Wish I had read the previous reviews.)
customer_reviews.author: N. Meehan

customer_reviews.title: Just the thing to keep the wife happy...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe not what you want to get her for her anniversary though. It could cause serious injury when thrown! In any case - I have been informed that Rowenta is the primo iron. Just so you know.
customer_reviews.author: Dwarf Eight

customer_reviews.title: Quick to heat up, great controls and balance. Effortless ironing!
customer_reviews.text: My fiance' has been raving about this iron ever since I bought it for him last year. I've only used a couple times, compared to his almost daily usage. It has great balance, glides super smoothly, and is really fast to heat up and remove wrinkles. He is pretty particular about ironing and takes significantly less time with this iron than he did with the old one. But the best part is hearing him rave about it almost weekly! So far it seems like this is a really well-made iron, I'll update my review if anything ever goes wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Real Iron Horse
customer_reviews.text: I have never had an iron this luxurious.... it is the best,,, and mama always said buy the best you can afford.... I am tired of other irons leaking and clogging... No problem with this iron.... Steams great, has a nice weight to it, great for ironing clothes or fabric for quilts or craft projects. Cannot believe I waited so long to upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: V. Wild

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't heat up well
customer_reviews.text: After reading a lot of reviews for different brands and a few months of search, I finally gave in and purchased this Rowenta iron. Immediately after I started using it, I realized it didn't heat well enough. My 15yr old Panasonic that had begin to fail was still heating better than this one. I returned this one and got another replacement from Amazon. The second one is doing exactly the same thing. I guess they are all made to hit only a certain temp. Not enough to iron out wrinkles unless I use a wrinkle out spray.
customer_reviews.author: asgali

customer_reviews.title: Spits white sandy stuff on clothing
customer_reviews.text: I just received my beautiful iron I’d been saving up for a Rowenta! Well it’s a lemon. Spitting a sand line substance all over my work clothes. It almost white. I believe the iron was used and returned. Amazon you’ve got to start ripping off hard-working people and creating problems for us. Now I have to return it and shop elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Easy way

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Rowenta iron and was really excited because of the reviews I have heard about the brand. Thus, I was very disappointed that on my first use, it actually did leak! I thought perhaps I put too much water, having filled it close to the max line. So I gave it another try another day but only filling it to a quarter level and it still leaked. Very very disappointed especially given the price point on this iron. Sadly, my return window closed a month after purchase (and I was traveling at that time too). I would not recommend anyone spending this much on an iron that leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe R

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product Life
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron. It disperses an even amount of steam when ironing. I believe it reduces my ironing time. My wife will testify that I iron almost every day. It is worth the investment. It can even save you from purchasing distilled water, since the instructions recommend you use tap water. Update-* I had to remove some stars because this iron does not have longevity. After 3 years of use, this iron has developed a short it the cord. I have spoken with other former Rowenta iron users and Rowenta irons are no longer made well. Although it did iron well, I can not justify the expense due to the poor product life.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Lattimore

product_meta.title: Rowenta DW2459 Access Steam Iron with Retractable Cord and Stainless Steel Soleplate, Black
product_meta.description: Style Name:1725-Watts with CordreelWith maximum steam distribution and high-quality engineering that's built to last, the Rowenta Accesteam Cordreel steam iron was designed for easier garment care, with the cordreel system offering effortless storage options. The stainless steel soleplate comes equipped with advanced Microsteam technology, providing ultimate steam coverage with over 350 micro-holes and 1725 Watts of power, for maximum efficiency and exceptional glide. High-quality stainless steel soleplate and a durable design ensure long-lasting performance, with enough steam power to tackle even the most stubborn creases. A variety of advanced features—including easy refills; vertical steaming of suits, delicates, or even curtains; a precision tip for hard-to-reach areas, and more—come together for a dependable and long-lasting steam iron package.
feature_bullets: STAINLESS-STEEL SOLEPLATE - Easy gliding across different garments, smoothing hard-to-reach areas, and 1725 Watts of steam power
350+ STEAM HOLES WITH 180 G/MIN SHOT OF STEAM – Excellent steam distribution and powerful wrinkle removal
RETRACTABLE CORDREEL - Ultimate ease of use and storage
3-SETTING THERMOSTAT KNOB – Easy to use and to select the ideal steam output based on fabric
USE TAP WATER TO IRON – Easily fill the iron with easy fill hole, anti-drip lid, and translucent water tank window
SAFETY COMES FIRST WITH ROWENTA – Automatic 3-way shut off system to prevent accidents

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars10,475 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
